intro: Paederia thorelii var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy paederia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in the spring. It is native to parts of Asia, including China, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. The leaves are usually opposite and have a rough texture, while the fruit is a small, dry capsule that disperses its seeds.
